levels.title: Score Board
levels.description: Find the carefully hidden 'Score Board' page.
levels.hint:
Try to find a reference or clue behind the scenes. Or simply guess what URL the Score Board might have.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/score-board.html#find-the-carefully-hidden-score-board-page

levels.title: Email Leak
levels.description: Perform an unwanted information disclosure by accessing data cross-domain.
levels.hint:
Try to find and attack an endpoint that responds with user information. SQL Injection is not the solution here.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/sensitive-data-exposure.html#perform-an-unwanted-information-disclosure-by-accessing-data-cross-domain

levels.title: Error Handling
levels.description: Provoke an error that is not very gracefully handled.
levels.hint:
Try to submit bad input to forms. Alternatively tamper with URL paths or parameters.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/security-misconfiguration.html#provoke-an-error-that-is-not-very-gracefully-handled

levels.title: Forged Review
levels.description: Post a product review as another user or edit any user's existing review.
levels.hint:
Observe the flow of product review posting and editing and see if you can exploit it.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/broken-access-control.html#post-a-product-review-as-another-user-or-edit-any-users-existing-review

levels.title: Login Admin
levels.description: Log in with the administrator's user account.
levels.hint:
Try different SQL Injection attack patterns depending whether you know the admin's email address or not.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/injection.html#log-in-with-the-administrators-user-account

levels.title: Login Jim
levels.description: Log in with Jim's user account.
levels.hint:
Try cracking Jim's password hash if you harvested it already. Alternatively, if you know Jim's email address, try SQL Injection.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/injection.html#log-in-with-jims-user-account

levels.title: Login Bender
levels.description: Log in with Bender's user account.
levels.hint:
If you know Bender's email address, try SQL Injection. Bender's password hash might not help you very much.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/injection.html#log-in-with-benders-user-account

levels.title: Password Strength
levels.description: Log in with the administrator's user credentials without previously changing them or applying SQL Injection.
levels.hint:
This one should be equally easy to a) brute force, b) crack the password hash or c) simply guess.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/broken-authentication.html#log-in-with-the-administrators-user-credentials-without-previously-changing-them-or-applying-sql-injection

levels.title: Five-Star Feedback
levels.description: Get rid of all 5-star customer feedback.
levels.hint:
Once you found admin section of the application, this challenge is almost trivial.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/broken-access-control.html#get-rid-of-all-5-star-customer-feedback

levels.title: Forged Feedback
levels.description: Post some feedback in another users name.
levels.hint:
You can solve this by tampering with the user interface or by intercepting the communication with the RESTful backend.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/broken-access-control.html#post-some-feedback-in-another-users-name

levels.title: Redirects Tier 1
levels.description: Let us redirect you to a donation site that went out of business.
levels.hint:
We might have failed to take this out of our code properly.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/forgotten-content.html#let-us-redirect-you-to-a-donation-site-that-went-out-of-business

levels.title: Redirects Tier 2
levels.description: Wherever you go, there you are.
levels.hint:
You have to find a way to beat the whitelist of allowed redirect URLs.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/roll-your-own-security.html#wherever-you-go-there-you-are

levels.title: Basket Access Tier 1
levels.description: View another user's shopping basket.
levels.hint:
Have an eye on the HTTP traffic while shopping. Alternatively try to find a client-side association of users to their basket.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/broken-access-control.html#view-another-users-shopping-basket

levels.title: Basket Access Tier 2
levels.description: Put an additional product into another user's shopping basket.
levels.hint:
Have an eye on the HTTP traffic while placing products in the shopping basket. Changing the quantity of products already in the basket doesn't count.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/broken-access-control.html#put-an-additional-product-into-another-users-shopping-basket

levels.title: Payback Time
levels.description: Place an order that makes you rich.
levels.hint:
You literally need to make the shop owe you any amount of money.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/improper-input-validation.html#place-an-order-that-makes-you-rich

levels.title: Confidential Document
levels.description: Access a confidential document.
levels.hint:
Analyze and tamper with links in the application that deliver a file directly.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/sensitive-data-exposure.html#access-a-confidential-document

levels.title: Forgotten Developer Backup
levels.description: Access a developer's forgotten backup file.
levels.hint:
You need to trick a security mechanism into thinking that the file you want has a valid file type.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/roll-your-own-security.html#access-a-developers-forgotten-backup-file

levels.title: Forgotten Sales Backup
levels.description: Access a salesman's forgotten backup file.
levels.hint:
You need to trick a security mechanism into thinking that the file you want has a valid file type.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/security-misconfiguration.html#access-a-salesmans-forgotten-backup-file

levels.title: Admin Section
levels.description: Access the administration section of the store.
levels.hint:
It is just slightly harder to find than the score board link.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/broken-access-control.html#access-the-administration-section-of-the-store

levels.title: Product Tampering
levels.description: Change the href of the link within the OWASP SSL Advanced Forensic Tool (O-Saft) product description into http://kimminich.de.
levels.hint:
Look for one of the following: a) broken admin functionality, b) holes in RESTful API or c) possibility for SQL Injection.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/broken-access-control.html#change-the-href-of-the-link-within-the-o-saft-product-description

levels.title: Vulnerable Library
levels.description: Inform the shop about a vulnerable library it is using. (Mention the exact library name and version in your comment)
levels.hint:
Report one of two possible answers via the "Contact Us" form. Do not forget to submit the library's version as well.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/vulnerable-components.html#inform-the-shop-about-a-vulnerable-library-it-is-using

levels.title: Weird Crypto
levels.description: Inform the shop about an algorithm or library it should definitely not use the way it does.
levels.hint:
Report one of four possible answers via the "Contact Us" form.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/sensitive-data-exposure.html#inform-the-shop-about-an-algorithm-or-library-it-should-definitely-not-use-the-way-it-does

levels.title: Easter Egg Tier 1
levels.description: Find the hidden easter egg.
levels.hint:
If you solved one of the three file access challenges, you already know where to find the easter egg.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/roll-your-own-security.html#find-the-hidden-easter-egg

levels.title: Easter Egg Tier 2
levels.description: Apply some advanced cryptanalysis to find the real easter egg.
levels.hint:
You might have to peel through several layers of tough-as-nails encryption for this challenge.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/security-through-obscurity.html#apply-some-advanced-cryptanalysis-to-find-the-real-easter-egg

levels.title: Forged Coupon
levels.description: Forge a coupon code that gives you a discount of at least 80%.
levels.hint:
Try either a) a knowledgable brute force attack or b) reverse engineering.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/sensitive-data-exposure.html#forge-a-coupon-code-that-gives-you-a-discount-of-at-least-80

levels.title: Upload Size
levels.description: Upload a file larger than 100 kB.
levels.hint:
You can attach a small file to the "File Complaint" form. Investigate how this upload actually works.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/improper-input-validation.html#upload-a-file-larger-than-100-kb

levels.title: Upload Type
levels.description: Upload a file that has no .pdf extension.
levels.hint:
You can attach a PDF file to the "File Complaint" form. Investigate how this upload actually works.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/improper-input-validation.html#upload-a-file-that-has-no-pdf-extension

levels.title: Arbitrary File Write
levels.description: Overwrite the Legal Information file.
levels.hint:
Look out for a tweet praising new functionality of the web shop.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/vulnerable-components.html#overwrite-the-legal-information-file

levels.title: Extra Language
levels.description: Retrieve the language file that never made it into production.
levels.hint:
Brute force is not the only option for this challenge, but a perfectly viable one.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/forgotten-content.html#retrieve-the-language-file-that-never-made-it-into-production

levels.title: CAPTCHA Bypass Tier 1
levels.description: Submit 10 or more customer feedbacks within 10 seconds.
levels.hint:
After finding a CAPTCHA bypass, write a script that automates feedback submission. Or open many browser tabs and be really quick.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/roll-your-own-security.html#submit-10-or-more-customer-feedbacks-within-10-seconds

levels.title: Zero Stars
levels.description: Give a devastating zero-star feedback to the store.
levels.hint:
Before you invest time bypassing the API, you might want to play around with the UI a bit.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/improper-input-validation.html#give-a-devastating-zero-star-feedback-to-the-store

levels.title: Imaginary Challenge
levels.description: Solve challenge #999. Unfortunately, this challenge does not exist.
levels.hint:
You need to trick the hacking progress persistence feature into thinking you solved challenge #999.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/sensitive-data-exposure.html#solve-challenge-999

levels.title: Login Bjoern
levels.description: Log in with Bjoern's Gmail account without previously changing his password, applying SQL Injection, or hacking his Google account.
levels.hint:
The security flaw behind this challenge is 100% Juice Shop's fault and 0% Google's.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/broken-authentication.html#log-in-with-bjoerns-gmail-account

levels.title: Login CISO
levels.description: Exploit OAuth 2.0 to log in with the Chief Information Security Officer's user account.
levels.hint:
Don't try to beat Google's OAuth 2.0 service. Rather investigate implementation flaws on Juice Shop's end.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/broken-authentication.html#exploit-oauth-20-to-log-in-with-the-cisos-user-account

levels.title: Login Support Team
levels.description: Log in with the support team's original user credentials without applying SQL Injection or any other bypass.
levels.hint:
The underlying flaw of this challenge is a lot more human error than technical weakness.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/security-misconfiguration.html#log-in-with-the-support-teams-original-user-credentials

levels.title: Login MC SafeSearch
levels.description: Log in with MC SafeSearch's original user credentials without applying SQL Injection or any other bypass.
levels.hint:
You should listen to MC's hit song "Protect Ya Passwordz".
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/sensitive-data-exposure.html#log-in-with-mc-safesearchs-original-user-credentials

levels.title: Premium Paywall
levels.description: Unlock Premium Challenge to access exclusive content.
levels.hint:
You do not have to pay anything to unlock this challenge! Nonetheless, donations are very much appreciated.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/sensitive-data-exposure.html#unlock-premium-challenge-to-access-exclusive-content

levels.title: Reset Jim's Password
levels.description: Reset Jim's password via the Forgot Password mechanism with the original answer to his security question.
levels.hint:
It's hard for celebrities to pick a security question from a hard-coded list where the answer is not publicly exposed.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/broken-authentication.html#reset-jims-password-via-the-forgot-password-mechanism

levels.title: Reset Bender's Password
levels.description: Reset Bender's password via the Forgot Password mechanism with the original answer to his security question.
levels.hint:
Not as trivial as Jim's but still not too difficult with some "Futurama" background knowledge.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/broken-authentication.html#reset-benders-password-via-the-forgot-password-mechanism

levels.title: Reset Morty's Password
levels.description: Reset Morty's password via the Forgot Password mechanism with his obfuscated answer to his security question.
levels.hint:
Find a way to bypass the rate limiting and brute force the obfuscated answer to Morty's security question.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/security-misconfiguration.html#reset-mortys-password-via-the-forgot-password-mechanism

levels.title: Reset Bjoern's Password Tier 2
levels.description: Reset the password of Bjoern's internal account via the Forgot Password mechanism with the original answer to his security question.
levels.hint:
Nothing a little bit of Facebook stalking couldn't reveal. Might involve a historical twist.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/broken-authentication.html#reset-the-password-of-bjoerns-internal-account-via-the-forgot-password-mechanism

levels.title: NoSQL Injection Tier 1
levels.description: Let the server sleep for some time. (It has done more than enough hard work for you)
levels.hint:
This challenge is essentially a stripped-down Denial of Service (DoS) attack.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/injection.html#let-the-server-sleep-for-some-time

levels.title: NoSQL Injection Tier 2
levels.description: Update multiple product reviews at the same time.
levels.hint:
Take a close look on how the equivalent of UPDATE-statements in MongoDB work.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/injection.html#update-multiple-product-reviews-at-the-same-time

levels.title: NoSQL Injection Tier 3
levels.description: All your orders are belong to us!
levels.hint:
Take a close look on how the $where query operator works in MongoDB.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/injection.html#all-your-orders-are-belong-to-us

levels.title: Retrieve Blueprint
levels.description: Deprive the shop of earnings by downloading the blueprint for one of its products.
levels.hint:
The product you might want to give a closer look is the OWASP Juice Shop Logo (3D-printed).
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/forgotten-content.html#deprive-the-shop-of-earnings-by-downloading-the-blueprint-for-one-of-its-products

levels.title: Typosquatting Tier 1
levels.description: Inform the shop about a typosquatting trick it has become victim of. (Mention the exact name of the culprit)
levels.hint:
This challenge has nothing to do with URLs or domains. Investigate the forgotten developer's backup file instead.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/vulnerable-components.html#inform-the-shop-about-a-typosquatting-trick-it-has-become-victim-of

levels.title: Typosquatting Tier 2
levels.description: Inform the shop about a more sneaky instance of typosquatting it fell for. (Mention the exact name of the culprit)
levels.hint:
This challenge has nothing to do with URLs or domains. There is no conveniently misplaced file helping you with this one. Or is there?
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/vulnerable-components.html#inform-the-shop-about-a-more-sneaky-instance-of-typosquatting-it-fell-for

levels.title: JWT Issues Tier 1
levels.description: Forge an essentially unsigned JWT token that impersonates the (non-existing) user jwtn3d@juice-sh.op.
levels.hint:
This challenge exploits a weird option that is supported when signing tokens with JWT.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/vulnerable-components.html#forge-an-essentially-unsigned-jwt-token

levels.title: JWT Issues Tier 2
levels.description: Forge an almost properly RSA-signed JWT token that impersonates the (non-existing) user rsa_lord@juice-sh.op.
levels.hint:
This challenge is explicitly not about acquiring the RSA private key used for JWT signing.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/vulnerable-components.html#forge-an-almost-properly-rsa-signed-jwt-token

levels.title: Misplaced Signature File
levels.description: Access a misplaced SIEM signature file.
levels.hint:
You need to trick a security mechanism into thinking that the file you want has a valid file type.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/roll-your-own-security.html#access-a-misplaced-siem-signature-file

levels.title: Deprecated Interface
levels.description: Use a deprecated B2B interface that was not properly shut down.
levels.hint:
The developers who disabled the interface think they could go invisible by just closing their eyes.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/forgotten-content.html#use-a-deprecated-b2b-interface-that-was-not-properly-shut-down

levels.title: XXE Tier 1
levels.description: Retrieve the content of C:\Windows\system.ini or /etc/passwd from the server. (This challenge is not available on Heroku!)
levels.hint:
The leverage point for this challenge is the deprecated B2B interface.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/xxe.html#retrieve-the-content-of-cwindowssystemini-or-etcpasswd-from-the-server

levels.title: XXE Tier 2
levels.description: Give the server something to chew on for quite a while. (This challenge is not available on Heroku!)
levels.hint:
It is not as easy as sending a large amount of data directly to the deprecated B2B interface.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/xxe.html#give-the-server-something-to-chew-on-for-quite-a-while

levels.title: RCE Tier 1
levels.description: Perform a Remote Code Execution that would keep a less hardened application busy forever.
levels.hint:
The feature you need to exploit for this challenge is not directly advertised anywhere.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/insecure-deserialization.html#perform-a-remote-code-execution-that-would-keep-a-less-hardened-application-busy-forever

levels.title: RCE Tier 2
levels.description: Perform a Remote Code Execution that occupies the server for a while without using infinite loops.
levels.hint:
Your attack payload must not trigger the protection against too many iterations.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/insecure-deserialization.html#perform-a-remote-code-execution-that-occupies-the-server-for-a-while-without-using-infinite-loops

levels.title: Blockchain Tier 1
levels.description: Learn about the Token Sale before its official announcement.
levels.hint:
The developers truly believe in "Security through Obscurity" over actual access restrictions.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/security-through-obscurity.html#learn-about-the-token-sale-before-its-official-announcement

levels.title: Security Policy
levels.description: Behave like any "white-hat" should.
levels.hint:
Undoubtably you want to read our security policy before conducting any research on our application.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/roll-your-own-security.html#behave-like-any-white-hat-should

levels.title: Steganography Tier 1
levels.description: Rat out a notorious character hiding in plain sight in the shop. (Mention the exact name of the character)
levels.hint:
No matter how good your eyes are, you will need tool assistance for this challenge.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/security-through-obscurity.html#rat-out-a-notorious-character-hiding-in-plain-sight-in-the-shop

levels.title: Supply Chain Attack
levels.description: Inform the development team about a danger to some of their credentials. (Send them the URL of the original report or the CVE of this vulnerability)
levels.hint:
This vulnerability will not affect any customer of the shop. It is aimed exclusively at its developers.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/broken-authentication.html#inform-the-development-team-about-a-danger-to-some-of-their-credentials

levels.title: Christmas Special
levels.description: Order the Christmas special offer of 2014.
levels.hint:
Find out how the application handles unavailable products and try to find a loophole.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/injection.html#order-the-christmas-special-offer-of-2014

levels.title: User Credentials
levels.description: Retrieve a list of all user credentials via SQL Injection
levels.hint:
Craft a UNION SELECT attack string against an endpoint that offers an unnecessary way to filter data.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/injection.html#retrieve-a-list-of-all-user-credentials-via-sql-injection

levels.title: Admin Registration
levels.description: Get registered as admin user.
levels.hint:
Assign the unassignable.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/improper-input-validation.html#get-registered-as-admin-user

levels.title: XSS Tier 0
levels.description: Perform a reflected XSS attack with <iframe src="javascript:alert(`xss`)">.
levels.hint:
Look for an input field where its content appears in the response HTML when its form is submitted.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/xss.html#perform-a-reflected-xss-attack

levels.title: XSS Tier 1
levels.description: Perform a DOM XSS attack with <iframe src="javascript:alert(`xss`)">.
levels.hint:
Look for an input field where its content appears in the HTML when its form is submitted.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/xss.html#perform-a-reflected-xss-attack

levels.title: XSS Tier 2
levels.description: Perform a persisted XSS attack with <iframe src="javascript:alert(`xss`)"> bypassing a client-side security mechanism.
levels.hint:
Only some input fields validate their input. Even less of these are persisted in a way where their content is shown on another screen.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/xss.html#perform-a-persisted-xss-attack-bypassing-a-client-side-security-mechanism

levels.title: XSS Tier 3
levels.description: Perform a persisted XSS attack with <iframe src="javascript:alert(`xss`)"> without using the frontend application at all.
levels.hint:
You need to work with the server-side API directly. Try different HTTP verbs on different entities exposed through the API.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/xss.html#perform-a-persisted-xss-attack-without-using-the-frontend-application-at-all

levels.title: XSS Tier 4
levels.description: Perform a persisted XSS attack with <iframe src="javascript:alert(`xss`)"> bypassing a server-side security mechanism.
levels.hint:
The "Comment" field in the "Contact Us" screen is where you want to put your focus on.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/xss.html#perform-a-persisted-xss-attack-bypassing-a-server-side-security-mechanism

levels.title: CSRF
levels.description: Change Bender's password into slurmCl4ssic without using SQL Injection or Forgot Password.
levels.hint:
The fact that the name of this challenge is "CSRF" is already a huge hint.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/broken-authentication.html#change-benders-password-into-slurmcl4ssic-without-using-sql-injection-or-forgot-password

levels.title: XSS Tier 5
levels.description: Perform a persisted XSS attack with <iframe src="javascript:alert(`xss`)"> through an HTTP header.
levels.hint:
Finding a piece of displayed information that could originate from an HTTP header is the part of this challenge.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/xss.html#perform-a-persisted-xss-attack-through-an-http-header

levels.title: Multiple Likes
levels.description: Like any review at least three times as the same user.
levels.hint:
Punctuality is the politeness of kings.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/race-condition.html#like-any-review-at-least-three-times-as-the-same-user

levels.title: SSTi
levels.description: Infect the server with juicy malware by abusing arbitrary command execution. (This challenge is not available on Heroku!)
levels.hint:
The search for a personal identity is the life of a man.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/injection.html#infect-the-server-with-malware-by-abusing-arbitrary-command-execution

levels.title: SSRF
levels.description: Request a hidden resource on server through server.
levels.hint:
Reverse the Bad and it gets Good again.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/broken-access-control.html#request-a-hidden-resource-on-server-through-server

levels.title: Login Amy
levels.description: Log in with Amy's original user credentials. (This could take 93.83 billion trillion trillion centuries to brute force, but luckily she did not read the "One Important Final Note")
levels.hint:
This challenge will make you go after a needle in a haystack.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/sensitive-data-exposure.html#log-in-with-amys-original-user-credentials

levels.title: Reset Bjoern's Password Tier 1
levels.description: Reset the password of Bjoern's OWASP account via the Forgot Password mechanism with the original answer to his security question.
levels.hint:
He might have spoilered it on at least one occasion where a camera was running. Maybe elsewhere as well.
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/broken-authentication.html#reset-the-password-of-bjoerns-owasp-account-via-the-forgot-password-mechanism

levels.title: Access Log
levels.description: Gain access to any access log file of the server.
levels.hint:
Who would want a server access log to be accessible through a web application?
https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content/part2/sensitive-data-exposure.html#gain-access-to-any-access-log-file-of-the-server
